name: Wood Elves
background:
Wood Elves are Elves who live in harmony with the forest and the magical beings within. Although lightly armoured, they are able to move quickly and strike at foes from far away, while relying on the trees themselves to slow their enemies. 

Over the centuries, Wood Elves have been betrayed by outsiders and even their own kin who have cut away at the edges of the forest. Now, they look on both outsiders and new ideas with suspicion, unwilling to bend in their traditions, even as their forests continue to shrink and the world threatens to leave them behind.
backgroundFull:
The ancestors of the Wood Elves migrated to the Heartwoods to find a new home, as human tribes had begun to encroach on their ancestral lands. Here, they met the Treelords, powerful beings who dwelt in the Heartwoods, and the two forged a pact. The Elves would protect and nurture the forest, never harming it without need, and in exchange, the Treelords would protect and provide for them. 

When Humans arrived at the edge of the forest, they cleared land for farming and cut trees for fuel. Together, the Elves and Treelords drove the humans back, though the humans held onto the land which they had cleared. While many Elves viewed the humans and their ways with distrust, others learned from their foe, taking metal weapons and tools from them, and they even began trading with them. They called themselves High Elves, as they built stone towers and carved out Kingdoms in the Heartwoods, claiming the forest lands for themselves. The remaining Wood Elves and their allied Treelords fought back against their former kin.

The Wood Elves won a costly victory, exiling the High Elves, and leaving their old towers to fall to ruin. The Wood Elves renewed their pacts and clung closely to their traditions, distrusting any who strayed from them. So it was that the Wood Elves remained in isolation for centuries, maintaining their old ways of life until the Havoc Gods arrived.

The followers of the Havoc Gods raided the forests, taking lumber for their weapons of war, and burning what they did not need. The Wood Elves fought desperately to drive them back, but it was soon clear that their enemies were too many. So, when the High Elves offered an alliance, the Wood Elves reluctantly accepted it. This alliance quickly grew, and the Wood Elves conceded large parts of their forest to give their allies lumber for weapons, ships, and fortifications. 

Yet when victory came, the Wood Elves had little to show for it, as their former allies claimed the land where the woods had once been, and some even sought to encroach further. Now, the Wood Elves fiercely guard what remains, but the forest continues to shrink with each passing year. Even some Treelords believe that their days are numbered as the forest continues to shrink. 

How will you uphold the ancient pacts of your people?

spells.name: Hunter's Strike
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Quick Shot against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (this._skirmish ? 1 : this.AuraSize), avgUnit: true }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Spirit Vines
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hits with AP(1) and Pierce. Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

parameters.name: spellHitRoll
parameters.value: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spellHitRoll.name: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spells.name: Natural Harmony
spells.effect: Pick up to four friendly units within 12", which get Resistance once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Tree Stomp
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy models within 24", which take 1 hit with AP(4) each.

spells.name: Tree-Bark Growth
spells.effect: Pick up to six friendly units within 12", which get Grounded Reinforcement once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Insect Attack
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 18", which take 2 hits each.

specialRules.name: Grounded Protection Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Grounded Protection. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Teleport
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, place this model anywhere fully within 6" of its position.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Precise
specialRules.description: Gets +1 to hit when attacking.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Wild Veil
specialRules.description: Enemies get -4" range when trying to shoot at units where all models have this rule, and -2" movement when trying to charge units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: Repel Ambushers
specialRules.description: Enemy units using Ambush must be set up over 12" away from this model's unit.

specialRules.name: Melee Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's melee weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Piercing Assault. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls in melee when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Shooter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Unpredictable Shooter. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run Shooter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Hit & Run Shooter. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Melee Evasion. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Quick Shot against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Resistance
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored. If the wounds were from a spell, then they are ignored on a 2+ instead.

specialRules.name: Wild Veil Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Wild Veil Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Pierce
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit that aren't blocked, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Rapid Advance Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Rapid Advance. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Speed Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which moves -2" when using Advance actions and -4" when using Rush/Charge actions once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Grounded Protection
specialRules.description: If a unit where all models have this rule has most of them within 1" of terrain, when they take wounds roll one die per wound, and on a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9 away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush cant seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model only rolls to check wound effects once it has taken at least X wounds, and is only Knocked Out on rolls of 5+X or more.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault
specialRules.description: This model gets AP(+1) when charging.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable
specialRules.description: When attacking, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Shooter
specialRules.description: When shooting, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after shooting or being in melee.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run Shooter
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after shooting.

specialRules.name: Quick
specialRules.description: Moves +2" when using Advance, and +2 when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot
specialRules.description: This model may shoot after using Rush actions.

specialRules.name: Wild Veil Boost
specialRules.description: If all models in this unit have Wild Veil, enemies get -8" range when shooting  them and -4" movement when charging them from Wild Veil (instead of only -4" and -2").

specialRules.name: Rapid Advance
specialRules.description: This model moves +4" when using Advance actions.

specialRules.name: Grounded Reinforcement
specialRules.description: If a unit where all models have this rule has most of them within 1" of terrain, they get +1 to defense rolls.
